Dataset#

Constructor#

Dataset(arrow_table[,Â info,Â split,Â ...])

A Dataset backed by an Arrow table.

Dataset.from_file(filename[,Â info,Â split,Â ...])

Instantiate a Dataset backed by an Arrow table at filename.

Dataset.from_buffer(buffer[,Â info,Â split,Â ...])

Instantiate a Dataset backed by an Arrow buffer.

Dataset.from_pandas(df[,Â features,Â info,Â ...])

Convert pandas.DataFrame to a pyarrow.Table to create a [Dataset].

Dataset.from_dict(mapping[,Â features,Â info,Â ...])

Convert dict to a pyarrow.Table to create a [Dataset].

Dataset.from_generator(generator[,Â ...])

Create a Dataset from a generator.

Attributes and underlying data#

Dataset.data

The Apache Arrow table backing the dataset.

Dataset.cache_files

The cache files containing the Apache Arrow table backing the dataset.

Dataset.num_columns

Number of columns in the dataset.

Dataset.num_rows

Number of rows in the dataset (same as [Dataset.__len__]).

Dataset.column_names

Names of the columns in the dataset.

Dataset.shape

Shape of the dataset (number of columns, number of rows).

Dataset.info

[~datasets.DatasetInfo] object containing all the metadata in the dataset.

Dataset.split

[~datasets.NamedSplit] object corresponding to a named dataset split.

Dataset.builder_name

Dataset.citation

Dataset.config_name

Dataset.description

Dataset.download_checksums

Dataset.download_size

Dataset.features

Dataset.homepage

Dataset.license

Dataset.size_in_bytes

Dataset.supervised_keys

Dataset.version

Reshaping, reorganizing#

Dataset.flatten([new_fingerprint,Â max_depth])

Flatten the table.

Dataset.cast(features[,Â batch_size,Â ...])

Cast the dataset to a new set of features.

Dataset.cast_column(column,Â feature[,Â ...])

Cast column to feature for decoding.

Dataset.add_column(name,Â column[,Â ...])

Add column to Dataset.

Dataset.remove_columns(column_names[,Â ...])

Remove one or several column(s) in the dataset and the features associated to them.

Dataset.rename_column(original_column_name,Â ...)

Rename a column in the dataset, and move the features associated to the original column under the new column name.

Dataset.rename_columns(column_mapping[,Â ...])

Rename several columns in the dataset, and move the features associated to the original columns under the new column names.

Dataset.select_columns(column_names[,Â ...])

Select one or several column(s) in the dataset and the features associated to them.

Dataset.class_encode_column(column[,Â ...])

Casts the given column as [~datasets.features.ClassLabel] and updates the table.

Sorting, selecting, filtering#

Dataset.sort(column_names[,Â reverse,Â ...])

Create a new dataset sorted according to a single or multiple columns.

Dataset.shuffle([seed,Â generator,Â ...])

Create a new Dataset where the rows are shuffled.

Dataset.select(indices[,Â keep_in_memory,Â ...])

Create a new dataset with rows selected following the list/array of indices.

Dataset.filter([function,Â with_indices,Â ...])

Apply a filter function to all the elements in the table in batches and update the table so that the dataset only includes examples according to the filter function.

Dataset.unique(column)

Return a list of the unique elements in a column.

Dataset.train_test_split([test_size,Â ...])

Return a dictionary ([datasets.DatasetDict]) with two random train and test subsets (train and test Dataset splits).

Dataset.shard(num_shards,Â index[,Â ...])

Return the index-nth shard from dataset split into num_shards pieces.

Data processing#

Dataset.map([function,Â with_indices,Â ...])

Apply a function to all the examples in the table (individually or in batches) and update the table.

Dataset.batch(batch_size[,Â drop_last_batch,Â ...])

Group samples from the dataset into batches.

Dataset.with_format([type,Â columns,Â ...])

Set __getitem__ return format (type and columns).

Dataset.with_transform(transform[,Â columns,Â ...])

Set __getitem__ return format using this transform.

Dataset.set_format([type,Â columns,Â ...])

Set __getitem__ return format (type and columns).

Dataset.set_transform(transform[,Â columns,Â ...])

Set __getitem__ return format using this transform.

Dataset.reset_format()

Reset __getitem__ return format to python objects and all columns.

Dataset.formatted_as([type,Â columns,Â ...])

To be used in a with statement.

Indexing, iteration#

Dataset.__len__()

Number of rows in the dataset.

Dataset.__iter__()

Iterate through the examples.

Dataset.iter(batch_size[,Â drop_last_batch])

Iterate through the batches of size batch_size.

Dataset.__getitem__()

Can be used to index columns (by string names) or rows (by integer index or iterable of indices or bools).

Serialization / IO / conversion#

Dataset.save_to_disk(dataset_path[,Â ...])

Saves a dataset to a dataset directory, or in a filesystem using any implementation of fsspec.spec.AbstractFileSystem.

Dataset.load_from_disk(dataset_path[,Â ...])

Loads a dataset that was previously saved using [save_to_disk] from a dataset directory, or from a filesystem using any implementation of fsspec.spec.AbstractFileSystem.

Dataset.to_csv(path_or_buf[,Â batch_size,Â ...])

Exports the dataset to csv

Dataset.to_pandas([batch_size,Â batched])

Returns the dataset as a pandas.DataFrame.

Dataset.to_dict([batch_size,Â batched])

Returns the dataset as a Python dict.

Dataset.to_json(path_or_buf[,Â batch_size,Â ...])

Export the dataset to JSON Lines or JSON.

Dataset.to_parquet(path_or_buf[,Â ...])

Exports the dataset to parquet

Dataset.to_sql(name,Â con[,Â batch_size])

Exports the dataset to a SQL database.

Dataset.to_iterable_dataset([num_shards])

Get an [datasets.IterableDataset] from a map-style [datasets.Dataset].

Dataset.push_to_hub(repo_id[,Â config_name,Â ...])

Pushes the dataset to the hub as a Parquet dataset.

Caching#

Dataset.cleanup_cache_files()

Clean up all cache files in the dataset cache directory, excepted the currently used cache file if there is one.

Indexing#

Dataset.add_faiss_index(column[,Â ...])

Add a dense index using Faiss for fast retrieval.

Dataset.add_faiss_index_from_external_arrays(...)

Add a dense index using Faiss for fast retrieval.

Dataset.save_faiss_index(index_name,Â file[,Â ...])

Save a FaissIndex on disk.

Dataset.load_faiss_index(index_name,Â file[,Â ...])

Load a FaissIndex from disk.

Dataset.add_elasticsearch_index(column[,Â ...])

Add a text index using ElasticSearch for fast retrieval.

Dataset.load_elasticsearch_index(index_name,Â ...)

Load an existing text index using ElasticSearch for fast retrieval.

Dataset.list_indexes()

List the colindex_nameumns/identifiers of all the attached indexes.

Dataset.get_index(index_name)

List the index_name/identifiers of all the attached indexes.

Dataset.drop_index(index_name)

Drop the index with the specified column.

Dataset.search(index_name,Â query[,Â k])

Find the nearest examples indices in the dataset to the query.

Dataset.search_batch(index_name,Â queries[,Â k])

Find the nearest examples indices in the dataset to the query.

Dataset.get_nearest_examples(index_name,Â query)

Find the nearest examples in the dataset to the query.

Dataset.get_nearest_examples_batch(...[,Â k])

Find the nearest examples in the dataset to the query.

Metadata#

Dataset.align_labels_with_mapping(label2id,Â ...)

Align the dataset's label ID and label name mapping to match an input label2id mapping.
